comment.author: 38465931@N00
comment._content: This was an amazing exhibit....he was so realistic that I was afraid to look this guy in the face for fear that he would lunge at me.

comment.author: 61219542@N00
comment._content: The sculptures of Rum Mueck are wonderful !!

comment.author: 77094133@N00
comment._content: I felt that at any time any of his sculptures could've jumped up and chased me right out of the museum! I'm so happy that I had the opportunity to see his work.

comment.author: 57183384@N00
comment._content: I had the honor of seeing this exhibit in November... the sculptures defy explanation and must be experienced.  That the sculptures are realistic is only part of the story... the scale and expressions convey a kind of reflection (and even criticism?) back to us, the viewers. One of my favorite installments ever.  Bravo!!!!!!!!

comment.author: 63479608@N00
comment._content: I saw some stupid girl touch this one when I was there. I wanted to punch her in the head. Great show, highly recommended! :)

comment.author: 63276268@N00
comment._content:
I loved the one of the hairless man crouched in the corner - looking so vulnerable and mistrusting. He almost looked like an abused animal.

This one, was this one called Wild Man? He was so lifelike. Every little hair and spot or bruise on his body - just amazing! His eyes were very haunting. I'm so glad I was able to make it to see this exhibit!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: This one is Wild Man and the hairless man is Big Man. We are pretty excited that Big Man will be on display here after the Ron Mueck tour while the Hirshhorn is undergoing renovation.

comment.author: 22208659@N00
comment._content: hope to get one of Ron´s exhibitions here down in mexico city

comment.author: 91567800@N00
comment._content: It was really nice of Ron to immortalize Zach Galifinakas this way... lol.
